alert.note: Alert for Owyhee Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 23 at 2:01PM MDT until September 25 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS AND LOW RH EXPECTED MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING... .Strong winds and low relative humidities are likely Monday afternoon into the early evening hours. Therefore a Fire Weather Watch has been issued. Conditions will be worse in the southern half of Vale and Burns BLM districts than in the northern half. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY MONDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR OWYHEE MOUNTAINS...BURNS BLM AND VALE BLM...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 423...636 AND 637... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * WINDS...Sustained winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts 30 to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 17%.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
